author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister N. Rangasamy on Wednesday inaugurated the Puducherry Traders’ Welfare Board in the Commercial Taxes Department, Ellaipillaichavady.

Mr. Rangasamy distributed membership forms to the traders. The office-bearers of Puducherry Traders’ Federation and officials were present.

The Chief Secretary heads the Board, which has the Secretary to Government (Finance/Commercial Taxes) as member.

The Board is represented by Commissioner, Commercial Taxes Department, Director, Local Administration Department, Joint Secretary/Deputy Secretary (Finance) and Commissioners of Puducherry and Oulgaret Municipalities.

The Board will have representatives of traders associations, not exceeding one from each association or trading community, representing four regions of UT to be nominated by the Government.

The objective is to provide members welfare measures such as group insurance scheme, financial assistance for marriage, , cash reward to the wards of members and any other welfare measures that may be entrusted to the Board by the Government, the notification said.
title: Rangasamy inaugurates Traders' Welfare Board
